citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult male potbellied pig, “Spanky”, has long, overgrown hooves that curve outward causing splaying and abnormal
positioning of the toes. Excessively overgrown hooves can result in abnormal weight distribution and eventually lead to
discomfort, pain, and lameness. Daily observation of each animal is necessary to identify abnormalities such as
overgrown hooves and claws. Correct by May 11, 2023 by ensuring the attending veterinarian is contacted and a plan is
in place to address the overgrown hooves. Additionally, ensure that daily observation is being performed on every animal
and abnormalities are promptly identified and communicated to the attending veterinarian to provide adequate treatment.

A run-in shelter located in a pen with 3 goats has a metal roof with numerous areas of damage, exposing sharp metal
edges. On the back left side of the shelter, the metal roof has a tear approximately 2 inches in length and the metal has
been bent, creating sharp edges. On the front left corner, the metal has caved in towards the shelter, also creating several
sharp points. On the right side of the shelter roof, there are two areas where the metal roof has tears with sharp and
exposed metal edges. Sharp points within primary enclosures can cause injuries to the animals housed within. Correct by
ensuring all housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult male potbellied pig, “Spanky”, has long, overgrown hooves that curve outward causing splaying and abnormal 
positioning of the toes. Excessively overgrown hooves can result in abnormal weight distribution and eventually lead to 
discomfort, pain, and lameness. Daily observation of each animal is necessary to identify abnormalities such as 
overgrown hooves and claws. Correct by May 11, 2023 by ensuring the attending veterinarian is contacted and a plan is 
in place to address the overgrown hooves. Additionally, ensure that daily observation is being performed on every animal 
and abnormalities are promptly identified and communicated to the attending veterinarian to provide adequate treatment. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
A run-in shelter located in a pen with 3 goats has a metal roof with numerous areas of damage, exposing sharp metal 
edges. On the back left side of the shelter, the metal roof has a tear approximately 2 inches in length and the metal has 
been bent, creating sharp edges. On the front left corner, the metal has caved in towards the shelter, also creating several 
sharp points. On the right side of the shelter roof, there are two areas where the metal roof has tears with sharp and 
exposed metal edges. Sharp points within primary enclosures can cause injuries to the animals housed within. Correct by 
ensuring all housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
